=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Here’s a plain‐language breakdown of what’s going on in this game:

1. Game Genre and Setting
 • It’s essentially a classic arcade space shooter. You control a spaceship (the “avatar”) flying above a base (a planet-like structure), with a starry “background” setting.  
 • Enemies – in the form of alien ships – appear, and they not only move around but also drop bombs.

2. Core Mechanics
 • Movement and Shooting: You steer your spaceship, which can fire a blue projectile (called “sam”) in an upward direction. When your shot hits an alien, it destroys the alien and boosts your score.
 • Enemy Behavior: Alien ships move around and “turn around” when hitting the screen’s edge. They act like bombers: with a small chance (about 1% each cycle) and a short delay between attempts, they sometimes drop red bombs that move downward.
 • Portals and Spawning: Enemies are spawned from two types of invisible portals. One spawns “alienBlue” at a slower rate (every 16 cycles, total of 20), and the other spawns “alienGreen” more frequently (every 12 cycles, again with 20 total). Managing these spawn points is key because once all portals and aliens disappear, you win the level.

3. Objectives and Win/Loss Conditions
 • Primary Objective: Clear the level by destroying all enemy aliens and their spawn portals.
 • Win Condition: When there are no aliens coming from any portal (both portals and aliens count reach zero), you win.
 • Loss Condition: If your avatar (the player-controlled spaceship) is destroyed, you lose.  
 • Scoring: Destroying aliens with your projectile (sam) increases your score, while colliding with aliens or enemy bombs lowers your score. In fact, if your avatar hits an alien or gets hit by a bomb, you lose one point per incident. Conversely, hitting an alien with your shot earns you two points.

4. Overall Strategy and Tactics
 • Offense: Keep your eyes on the incoming enemies and focus on shooting them down with accurate, well-timed blasts. Try to hit enemies with your “sam” because those give you the best score boost and help clear the board.
 • Defense: Avoid direct collisions – if your spaceship runs into an alien or a bomb, it not only reduces your score but may also cost you your ship. Keep moving to dodge bombs that drop toward the base and your avatar.
 • Portal Control: Since new enemies spawn at fixed intervals from the portals, targeting and eliminating them (or the aliens they create) is key to preventing overwhelming numbers. Clearing or managing these spawn points helps you progress toward the victory condition.
 • Balance: Don’t let the action get too hectic. Use the boundaries of the level to “step back” when needed (your avatar bounces off the screen edge), and steer clear of enemy projectiles. Maintain a balance between advancing your position offensively and staying safe on the defensive.

In summary, you’re playing a space shooter where you must navigate, shoot enemies, and dodge incoming bombs—all while keeping an eye on enemy spawners. The best overall strategy is to keep moving, shoot with precision, and focus on clearing out both the aliens and their portals before they overwhelm your base and your spaceship.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
